onyomiExamples.meaning: to grow senile, to be childish with age, to be mentally slow, to be befuddled, to play stupid, to say something stupid (oft. on purpose; esp. as part of a comedic routine), to become engrossed in, to become absorbed in

onyomiExamples.reading: オドルアホウニミルアホウ
onyomiExamples.meaning: you're a fool if you dance, and a fool if you just look on; we're all fools, so let's dance

to be amazed, to be shocked, to be astonished, to be astounded, to be disgusted, to be exasperated, to be fed up
